snippet: President Hamid Karzai declared Sunday a national day of mourning and ordered all flags flown at half-staff, after officials said they feared that more than 2,000 people were dead.
abstract: Local Afghan officials say they fear more than 2,000 people are dead after landslides bury much of northeastern village of Abi Barak; Pres Hamid Karzai declares national day of mourning and ordered all flags flown at half-staff.

byline.contributor: Haris Kakar and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai declared Sunday a national day of mourning and ordered all flags flown at half-staff, after officials said they feared that more than 2,000 people were dead.

headline.main: ‘No Hope’ for Those Buried by Mudslide, Afghanistan Official Says
headline.print_headline: More Than 2,000 Feared Dead in Landslides
